Pre-Game Insights: Yves Missi and the New Orleans Pelicans host Deni Avdija and the Portland Trail Blazers in Western Conference play.
The Pelicans are 3-18 in Western Conference games.
The Trail Blazers have gone 10-20 against Western Conference opponents.
Portland is seventh in the league with 12.3 offensive rebounds per game led by Deandre Ayton averaging 2.8.
The Pelicans average 11.6 made 3-pointers per game this season, 2.4 fewer makes per game than the Trail Blazers give up (14.0).
The Trail Blazers' 44.9% shooting percentage from the field this season is 3.5 percentage points lower than the Pelicans have allowed to their opponents (48.4%).
CJ McCollum is shooting 44.9% and averaging 22.1 points for the Pelicans.
Avdija is averaging 13.7 points, 6.1 rebounds and 3.2 assists for the Trail Blazers.

Pelicans: 2-8 in their last 10 games, averaging 113.0 points, 41.2 rebounds, 28.4 assists, 10.1 steals and 5.9 blocks per game while shooting 44.9% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 118.6 points per game.

Trail Blazers: 4-6 in their last 10 games, averaging 111.4 points, 44.6 rebounds, 25.6 assists, 7.2 steals and 4.5 blocks per game while shooting 47.6% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 118.7 points.
Others: Injuries: Trail Blazers: Matisse Thybulle: out (ankle), Donovan Clingan: day to day (rest), Deni Avdija: day to day (wrist), Jerami Grant: out (face).
